alert.note: Alert for Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 8:30PM CDT until June 25 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN DUBUQUE AND EAST CENTRAL DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 830 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Balltown, or 11 miles northwest of Dubuque, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Asbury, Dyersville, Epworth, East Dubuque, Farley, Peosta, New Vienna, Holy Cross, Luxemburg, Rickardsville, Sherrill, Centralia, Sageville, Balltown, Bankston, Durango, Graf, Bankston Park and Rockdale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
